intro: Ortholoma ulei, commonly known as the California ortholoma, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its small white or yellowish flowers are arranged in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Ortholoma ulei is often used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities for its purported health benefits.
